title: How to Play Call of Duty for PC Well

steps.headline: Learn which weapon suits you.
steps.description: If you enjoy sitting back and sniping, then a rifle or scoped weapon would be great for you.

steps.headline: Move- Call of Duty 4 is designed to encourage movement.
steps.description: Always think to yourself: Where is my enemy going to be next?

steps.headline: The most important thing is... HAVE FUN!
steps.description: If you get too frustrated, that will usually hurt your score.

steps.headline: Try to get a kill ratio of 3:1, that is a "l33t" score most of the time.
The best players do not have their kill totals anywhere near their death totals- if the last rush didn't work, don't do it again.
Don't camp.
steps.description: Camping is basically getting easy kills - you do not learn as much as if you were rushing. Hunting campers from their holes is always good.

steps.headline: When sniping, decide if you are going to move with your men or sit back.
steps.description: If you sit back DO NOT MOVE. This makes it easier to be spotted. Depending on your spot place claymores-sometimes claymores can be more of a giveaway then a help. If you are moving with your troops then learn to shoot without bring your scope up entirely.

steps.headline: Be creative- use your knowledge of the map or weapons to get the upper hand.
Use perks that compliment your weapon as they will pay off more in the long run.

text: Learn which weapon suits you. If you enjoy sitting back and sniping, then a rifle or scoped weapon would be great for you. Move- Call of Duty 4 is designed to encourage movement. Always think to yourself: Where is my enemy going to be next? Aim for the head.  Know your maps.  The most important thing is... HAVE FUN! If you get too frustrated, that will usually hurt your score. Try to get a kill ratio of 3:1, that is a "l33t" score most of the time.  The best players do not have their kill totals anywhere near their death totals- if the last rush didn't work, don't do it again.  Don't camp. Camping is basically getting easy kills - you do not learn as much as if you were rushing. Hunting campers from their holes is always good. When sniping, decide if you are going to move with your men or sit back. If you sit back DO NOT MOVE. This makes it easier to be spotted. Depending on your spot place claymores-sometimes claymores can be more of a giveaway then a help. If you are moving with your troops then learn to shoot without bring your scope up entirely. Be creative- use your knowledge of the map or weapons to get the upper hand.  Use perks that compliment your weapon as they will pay off more in the long run.
